title: How to Plan an Amazing Party at Your House

steps.headline: Choose one main room to have your party in.
steps.description: Make sure you have enough space and your guests don't feel uncomfortable. Don't just restrict them to one room, but make sure they know where is off limits (parents bedroom, ect).

steps.headline: Make sure everywhere is tidy.
steps.description: Your guests would not feel very comfortable in a messy house and there wouldn't be enough room to move about

steps.headline: Decorate your room to make it look party-ish.
steps.description: Balloons and streamers are always fun! Remember, your friends aren't just over for tea - they have come for a party. Make things bright and colourful!

steps.headline: Make sure any other family members stay out of the way as to not interrupt or get in your way.
Make sure you have the following in your room on standby to ensure your guests don't get bored.
steps.description:
TV
Radio/CD player/MP3 speaker
Plenty of music/CDs
Plenty of movies and TV programmes
Space to sit - Chairs, beanbags, cushions, sofas, beds ect
Good lighting - not too bright but not super dark (you Don't want anyone to fall asleep! Games - Twister, Truth or dare, guess who? ect

steps.headline: Have other things to do in different rooms.
steps.description: Go in the garden, play with pets, have a walk around your town or village, cook something in the kitchen. The choice is yours!

steps.headline: Have small bowls of snacks dotted around the room to stop your guests from getting hungry.
steps.description:
You could have:
Crisps
Sweets
Chocolate
Popcorn
Pretzels

steps.headline: If your guests are staying for a meal then either order a takeaway and get food delivered or make party food and just help yourselves.
steps.description: Make sure you stock up on disposable cutlery and crockery so you don't have to wash up afterwards!

steps.headline: Make a sundae bar.
steps.description: Buy small cardboard tubs from a supermarket and some vanilla ice cream. Then get some whipped cream and put sprinkles and sweets in bowls, then you're done. Don't forget the sauce!! !

steps.headline: Make sure your guests stay hydrated.
steps.description: If you are allowed, stock up on beer and wine, if not, buy some fizzy drinks or make slushies. You could buy little umbrellas and straws to jazz them up a bit, and make sure to buy disposable cups.

steps.headline: Only invite a few close friends.
steps.description: You won't have enough room in your house for loads of people. Maximum amount is probably around 8.

steps.headline: Make invites or send them over email so guests have a written copy of dates and times.
steps.description: They could forget if you just tell them!

steps.headline: Make sure nobody is left out - you wouldn't like it if you were the only one not invited to a party.

text:
Space and decorations Choose one main room to have your party in. Make sure you have enough space and your guests don't feel uncomfortable. Don't just restrict them to one room, but make sure they know where is off limits (parents bedroom, ect). Make sure everywhere is tidy. Your guests would not feel very comfortable in a messy house and there wouldn't be enough room to move about Decorate your room to make it look party-ish. Balloons and streamers are always fun! Remember, your friends aren't just over for tea - they have come for a party. Make things bright and colourful! Make sure any other family members stay out of the way as to not interrupt or get in your way.  Entertainment Make sure you have the following in your room on standby to ensure your guests don't get bored. TV
Radio/CD player/MP3 speaker
Plenty of music/CDs
Plenty of movies and TV programmes
Space to sit - Chairs, beanbags, cushions, sofas, beds ect
Good lighting - not too bright but not super dark (you Don't want anyone to fall asleep! Games - Twister, Truth or dare, guess who? ect Have other things to do in different rooms. Go in the garden, play with pets, have a walk around your town or village, cook something in the kitchen. The choice is yours! Food Have small bowls of snacks dotted around the room to stop your guests from getting hungry. You could have:
Crisps
Sweets
Chocolate
Popcorn
Pretzels If your guests are staying for a meal then either order a takeaway and get food delivered or make party food and just help yourselves. Make sure you stock up on disposable cutlery and crockery so you don't have to wash up afterwards! Make a sundae bar. Buy small cardboard tubs from a supermarket and some vanilla ice cream. Then get some whipped cream and put sprinkles and sweets in bowls, then you're done. Don't forget the sauce!! ! Make sure your guests stay hydrated. If you are allowed, stock up on beer and wine, if not, buy some fizzy drinks or make slushies. You could buy little umbrellas and straws to jazz them up a bit, and make sure to buy disposable cups. Guests Only invite a few close friends. You won't have enough room in your house for loads of people. Maximum amount is probably around 8. Make invites or send them over email so guests have a written copy of dates and times. They could forget if you just tell them! Make sure nobody is left out - you wouldn't like it if you were the only one not invited to a party.
